thread.title: Amanda Palmer and Legendary Pink Dots’ Edward Ka-Spel Announce New Album and Tour
thread.title_full: Amanda Palmer and Legendary Pink Dots’ Edward Ka-Spel Announce New Album and Tour

author: Michelle Kim
title: Amanda Palmer and Legendary Pink Dots’ Edward Ka-Spel Announce New Album and Tour
text:
Amanda Palmer and Legendary Pink Dots’ Edward Ka-Spel Announce New Album and Tour I Can Spin a Rainbow was recorded in Imogen Heap’s home recording studio Amanda Palmer photo by Frank Hoensch/Redferns for Getty Images 
Amanda Palmer has announced a new album with founding member of cult psychedelic band The Legendary Pink Dots , Edward Ka-Spel . It’s called I Can Spin a Rainbow and arrives May 5 — view the tracklisting below. According to a press release, I Can Spin a Rainbow was recorded in Imogen Heap ’s Essex, England home studio, the Hideaway. Palmer and Ka-Spel have also announced tour dates in the U.S. and Europe, find them below. 
Read our long form piece from 2012 on Amanda Palmer’s crowdsourcing model . 
I Can Spin a Rainbow : 
01 Pulp Fiction 02 Shahla’s Missing Page 03 The Shock of Kontakt 04 Beyond The Beach 05 The Clock at the Back of the Cage 06 The Changing Room 07 The Jack of Hands 08 Prithee: Liquidation Day 10 The Sun Still Shines* 11 Subway* 
Amanda Palmer and Edward Ka-Spel: 
05-17 Boston, MA - Middle East 05-20 New York, NY - Bowery Ballroom 05-21 Brooklyn, NY - Rough Trade NYC 05-23 San Francisco, CA - DNA Lounge 05-24 Los Angeles, CA - Troubadour 05-31 Warsaw, Poland - Proxima 06-02 Leipzig, Germany - Wave & Gotik Treffen 06-04 Prague, Czech Republic - Palác Akropolis 06-05 Hamburg, Germany - Fabrik 06-09 Antwerp, Belgium - Trix Club 06-10 Amsterdam, Netherlands - Melkweg 06-13 London, England - Heaven 06-16 Vienna, Austria - Porgy & Bess 
Watch the official video for Amanda Palmer and her dad Jack’s “Wynken, Blynken & Nod” on Pitchfork.tv: Artists In This Story
